metadata.title: NIST SP 800-171 Rev. 3 CUI Overlay Profile

set-parameters.label: Parameter for 03-01-11.
set-parameters.usage: Organization-defined: organization-defined conditions or trigger events requiring session disconnect

set-parameters.label: Parameter for 03-03-07b.
set-parameters.usage: Organization-defined: organization-defined granularity of time measurement

set-parameters.label: Parameter for 03-04-06b.
set-parameters.usage: Organization-defined: organization-defined functions, ports, protocols, connections, and services

set-parameters.label: Parameter for 03-05-01b.
set-parameters.usage: Organization-defined: organization-defined circumstances or situations requiring re-authentication

set-parameters.label: Parameter for 03-05-02.
set-parameters.usage: Organization-defined: organization-defined devices or types of devices

set-parameters.label: Parameter for 03-05-05d.
set-parameters.usage: Organization-defined: organization-defined characteristic identifying individual status

set-parameters.label: Parameter for 03-05-07f.
set-parameters.usage: Organization-defined: organization-defined composition and complexity rules

set-parameters.label: Parameter for 03-08-07a.
set-parameters.usage: Organization-defined: organization-defined types of system media

set-parameters.label: Parameter for 03-10-02b.
set-parameters.usage: Organization-defined: organization-defined events or potential indications of events

set-parameters.label: Parameter for 03-13-10.
set-parameters.usage: Organization-defined: organization-defined requirements for key generation, distribution, storage, access, and destruction

set-parameters.label: Parameter for 03-13-12a.
set-parameters.usage: Organization-defined: organization-defined exceptions where remote activation is to be allowed

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.01  Account Management

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.01.a. Define the types of system accounts allowed and prohibited.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.01.b. Create, enable, modify, disable, and remove system accounts in accordance with policy, procedures, prerequisites, and criteria.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.01.c. Specify:

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.01.c.01. Authorized users of the system,

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.01c.02. Group and role membership, and

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.01.c.03. Access authorizations (i.e., privileges) for each account.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.01.d. Authorize access to the system based on:

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.01.d.01. A valid access authorization and

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.01.d.02. Intended system usage.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.01.e. Monitor the use of system accounts.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.01.f. Disable system accounts when:

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.01.f.01. The accounts have expired;

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.01.f.02. The accounts have been inactive for {{ insert: param, param-030101f02-1 }};

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.01.f.03. The accounts are no longer associated with a user or individual;

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.01.f.04. Are in violation of organizational policy; or

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.01.f.05.	 Significant risks associated with individuals are discovered.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.01.g. Notify account managers and designated personnel or roles within:

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.01.g.01. {{ insert: param, param-030101g01-1 }} when accounts are no longer required.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.01.g.02. {{ insert: param, param-030101g02-1 }} when users are terminated or transferred.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.01.g.03. {{ insert: param, param-030101g03-1 }} when system usage or the need-to-know changes for an individual.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.01.h. 	Require that users log out of the system after {{ insert: param, param-030101h-1 }} of expected inactivity or when {{ insert: param, param-030101h-2 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.02. Enforce approved authorizations for logical access to CUI and system resources in accordance with applicable access control policies.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.02  Access Enforcement

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.03. Enforce approved authorizations for controlling the flow of CUI within the system and between connected systems.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.03  Information Flow Enforcement

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.04  Separation of Duties

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.04.a. Identify the duties of individuals requiring separation.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.04.b. Define system access authorizations to support separation of duties.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.05  Least Privilege

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.05.a. Allow only authorized system access for users (or processes acting on behalf of users) that is necessary to accomplish assigned organizational tasks.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.05.b. 	Authorize access to {{ insert: param, param-030105b-1 }} and {{ insert: param, param-030105b-2 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.05.c. 	Review the privileges assigned to roles or classes of users {{ insert: param, param-030105c-1 }} to validate the need for such privileges.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.05.d. Reassign or remove privileges, as necessary.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.06  Least Privilege – Privileged Accounts

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.06.a. Restrict privileged accounts on the system to {{ insert: param, param-030106a-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.06.b. Require that users (or roles) with privileged accounts use non-privileged accounts when accessing non-security functions or non-security information.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.07  Least Privilege – Privileged Functions

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.07.a. Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.07.b. Log the execution of privileged functions.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.08  Unsuccessful Logon Attempts

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.08.a. 	Enforce a limit of {{ insert: param, param-030108a-1 }} consecutive invalid logon attempts by a user during a {{ insert: param, param-030108a-2 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.08.b. Automatically [Selection (one or more): lock the account or node for an {{ insert: param, param-030108b-1 }}; lock the account or node until released by an administrator; delay next logon prompt; notify system administrator; take other action] when the maximum number of unsuccessful attempts is exceeded.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.09. Display a system use notification message with privacy and security notices consistent with applicable CUI rules before granting access to the system.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.09  System Use Notification

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.10  Device Lock

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.10.a. Prevent access to the system by [Selection (one or more): initiating a device lock after {{ insert: param, param-030110a-1 }} of inactivity; requiring the user to initiate a device lock before leaving the system unattended].

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.10.b. Retain the device lock until the user reestablishes access using established identification and authentication procedures.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.10.c. Conceal, via the device lock, information previously visible on the display with a publicly viewable image.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.11. Terminate a user session automatically after {{ insert: param, param-030111-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.11  Session Termination

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.12  Remote Access

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.12.a. Establish usage restrictions, configuration requirements, and connection requirements for each type of allowable remote system access.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.12.b. Authorize each type of remote system access prior to establishing such connections.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.12.c. Route remote access to the system through authorized and managed access control points.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.12.d. Authorize remote execution of privileged commands and remote access to security-relevant information.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.16  Wireless Access

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.16.a. Establish usage restrictions, configuration requirements, and connection requirements for each type of wireless access to the system.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.16.b. Authorize each type of wireless access to the system prior to establishing such connections.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.16.c. Disable, when not intended for use, wireless networking capabilities prior to issuance and deployment.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.18  Access Control for Mobile Devices

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.18.a. Establish usage restrictions, configuration requirements, and connection requirements for mobile devices.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.18.b. Authorize the connection of mobile devices to the system.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.18.c. Implement full-device or container-based encryption to protect the confidentiality of CUI on mobile devices.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.20  Use of External Systems

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.20.a. Prohibit the use of external systems unless the systems are specifically authorized.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.20.b. Establish the following security requirements to be satisfied on external systems prior to allowing use of or access to those systems by authorized individuals: {{ insert: param, param-030120b-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.20.c. Permit authorized individuals to use external systems to access the organizational system or to process, store, or transmit CUI only after:

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.20c. Permit authorized individuals to use an external system to access the organizational system or to process, store, or transmit CUI only after:

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.20.c.01. Verifying that the security requirements on the external systems as specified in the organization’s system security plans have been satisfied and

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.20.c.02. Retaining approved system connection or processing agreements with the organizational entities hosting the external systems.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.20.d. Restrict the use of organization-controlled portable storage devices by authorized individuals on external systems.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.22  Publicly Accessible Content

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.22.a. Train authorized individuals to ensure that publicly accessible information does not contain CUI.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.22.b. Review the content on publicly accessible systems for CUI periodically and remove such information, if discovered.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.02.01  Literacy Training and Awareness

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.02.01.a.02. When required by system changes or following {{ insert: param, param-030201a02-1 }}; and

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.02.01.a. Provide security literacy training to system users:

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.02.01.a..01. As part of initial training for new users and {{ insert: param, param-030201a01-1 }} thereafter,

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.02.01.a.03. On recognizing and reporting indicators of insider threat, social engineering, and social mining.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.02.01.b. Update security literacy training content {{ insert: param, param-030201b-1 }} and following {{ insert: param, param-030201b-2 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.02.02  Role-Based Training

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.02.02.a. Provide role-based security training to organizational personnel:

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.02.02.a.01. Before authorizing access to the system or CUI, before performing assigned duties, and {{ insert: param, param-030202a01-1 }} thereafter

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.02.02.a.02. When required by system changes or following {{ insert: param, param-030202a02-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.02.02.b. Update role-based training content {{ insert: param, param-030202b-1 }} and following {{ insert: param, param-030202b-2 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.03.01  Event Logging

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.03.01.a. Specify the following event types selected for logging within the system: {{ insert: param, param-030301a-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.03.01.b. Review and update the event types selected for logging {{ insert: param, param-030301b-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.03.02  Audit Record Content

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.03.02.a. Include the following content in audit records:

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.03.02.a.01. What type of event occurred;

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.03.02.a.02. When the event occurred;

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.03.02.a.03. Where the event occurred;

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.03.02.a.04. Source of the event;

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.03.02.a.05. Outcome of the event;

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.03.02.a.06. Identity of individuals, subjects, objects, or entities associated with the event; and

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.03.02.b. Provide additional information for audit records as needed.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.03.03  Audit Record Generation

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.03.03a. Generate audit records for the selected event types and audit record content specified in 03.03.01 and 03.03.02.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.03.03.b. Retain audit records for a time period consistent with the records retention policy.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.03.04  Response to Audit Logging Process Failures

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.03.04.a. Alert organizational personnel or roles within {{ insert: param, param-030304a-1 }} in the event of an audit logging process failure.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.03.04.b. Take the following additional actions: {{ insert: param, param-030304b-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.03.05  Audit Record Review, Analysis, and Reporting

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.03.05.a. Review and analyze system audit records {{ insert: param, param-030305a-1 }} for indications and the potential impact of inappropriate or unusual activity.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.03.05.b. Report findings to organizational personnel or roles.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.03.05.c. Analyze and correlate audit records across different repositories to gain organization-wide situational awareness.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.03.06  Audit Record Reduction and Report Generation

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.03.06.a. Implement an audit record reduction and report generation capability that supports audit record review, analysis, reporting requirements, and after-the-fact investigations of incidents.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.03.06.b. Preserve the original content and time ordering of audit records.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.03.07  Time Stamps

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.03.07.a. Use internal system clocks to generate time stamps for audit records.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.03.07.b. Record time stamps for audit records that meet {{ insert: param, param-030307b-1 }} and that use Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), have a fixed local time offset from UTC, or include the local time offset as part of the time stamp.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.03.08  Protection of Audit Information

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.03.08.a. Protect audit information and audit logging tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.03.08.b. Authorize access to management of audit logging functionality to only a subset of privileged users or roles.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.01  Baseline Configuration

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.01.a. Develop, document, and maintain under configuration control, a current baseline configuration of the system.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.01.b.	Review and update the baseline configuration of the system {{ insert: param, param-030401b-1 }} and when system components are installed or modified.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.01.b. Review and update the baseline configuration of the system {{ insert: param, param-030401b-1 }} and when system components are installed or modified.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.02  Configuration Settings

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.02.a. Establish, document, and implement the following configuration settings for the system that reflect the most restrictive mode consistent with operational requirements: {{ insert: param, param-030402a-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.02.b. Identify, document, and approve any deviations from established configuration settings.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.03  Configuration Change Control

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.03.a. Define the types of changes to the system that are configuration-controlled.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.03.b. Review proposed configuration-controlled changes to the system and approve or disapprove such changes with explicit consideration for security impacts.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.03.c. Implement and document approved configuration-controlled changes to the system.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.03.d. Monitor and review activities associated with configuration-controlled changes to the system.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.04  Impact Analyses

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.04.a. Analyze changes to the system to determine potential security impacts prior to change implementation.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.04.b. Verify that the security requirements for the system continue to be satisfied after the system changes have been implemented.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.05. Define, document, approve, and enforce physical and logical access restrictions associated with changes to the system.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.05  Access Restrictions for Change

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.06  Least Functionality

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.06.a. Configure the system to provide only mission-essential capabilities.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.06.b. Prohibit or restrict use of the following functions, ports, protocols, connections, and services: {{ insert: param, param-030406b-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.06.c. Review the system {{ insert: param, param-030406c-1 }} to identify unnecessary or nonsecure functions, ports, protocols, connections, and services.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.06.d. Disable or remove functions, ports, protocols, connections, and services that are unnecessary or nonsecure.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.08  Authorized Software – Allow by Exception

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.08.a. Identify software programs authorized to execute on the system.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.08.b. Implement a deny-all, allow-by-exception policy for the execution of authorized software programs on the system.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.08.c. Review and update the list of authorized software programs {{ insert: param, param-030408c-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.10  System Component Inventory

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.10.a. Develop and document an inventory of system components.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.10.b. Review and update the system component inventory {{ insert: param, param-030410b-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.10.c. Update the system component inventory as part of installations, removals, and system updates.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.11  Information Location

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.11.a. Identify and document the location of CUI and the system components on which the information is processed and stored.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.11.b. Document changes to the system or system component location where CUI is processed and stored.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.12  System and Component Configuration for High-Risk Areas

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.12.a. Issue systems or system components with the following configurations to individuals traveling to high-risk locations: {{ insert: param, param-030412a-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.04.12.b. Apply the following security requirements to the system or system components when the individuals return from travel: {{ insert: param, param-030412b-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.05.01  User Identification, Authentication, and Re-Authentication

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.05.01.a. Uniquely identify and authenticate system users and associate that unique identification with processes acting on behalf of those users.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.05.01.b. Re-authenticate users when {{ insert: param, param-030501b-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.05.02. Uniquely identify and authenticate {{ insert: param, param-030502-1 }} before establishing a system connection.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.05.02  Device Identification and Authentication

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.05.03. Implement multi-factor authentication for access to privileged and non-privileged accounts.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.05.03  Multi-Factor Authentication

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.05.04. Implement replay-resistant authentication mechanisms for access to privileged and non-privileged accounts.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.05.04  Replay-Resistant Authentication

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.05.05  Identifier Management

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.05.05.a. Receive authorization from organizational personnel or roles to assign an individual, group, role, service, or device identifier.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.05.05.b. Select and assign an identifier that identifies an individual, group, role, service, or device.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.05.05.c. Prevent the reuse of identifiers for {{ insert: param, param-030505c-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.05.05.d. Manage individual identifiers by uniquely identifying each individual as {{ insert: param, param-030505d-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.05.07  Password Management

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.05.07.a. Maintain a list of commonly-used, expected, or compromised passwords, and update the list {{ insert: param, param-030507a-1 }} and when organizational passwords are suspected to have been compromised.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.05.07.b. Verify that passwords are not found on the list of commonly used, expected, or compromised passwords when users create or update passwords.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.05.07.c. Transmit passwords only over cryptographically-protected channels.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.05.07.d. Store passwords in a cryptographically-protected form.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.05.07.e. Select a new password upon first use after account recovery.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.05.07.f. Enforce the following composition and complexity rules for passwords: {{ insert: param, param-030507f-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.05.11. Obscure feedback of authentication information during the authentication process.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.05.11  Authentication Feedback

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.05.12  Authenticator Management

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.05.12.a. Verify the identity of the individual, group, role, service, or device receiving the authenticator as part of the initial authenticator distribution.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.05.12.b. Establish initial authenticator content for any authenticators issued by the organization.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.05.12.c. Establish and implement administrative procedures for initial authenticator distribution, for lost, compromised, or damaged authenticators, and for revoking authenticators.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.05.12.d. Change default authenticators at first use.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.05.12.e. Change or refresh authenticators {{ insert: param, param-030512e-1 }} or when the following events occur: {{ insert: param, param-030512e-2 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.05.12.f. Protect authenticator content from unauthorized disclosure and modification.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.06.01. Implement an incident-handling capability for incidents that is consistent with the incident response plan and includes preparation, detection and analysis, containment, eradication, and recovery.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.06.01  Incident Handling

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.06.02  Incident Monitoring, Reporting, and Response Assistance

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.06.02.a. Track and document system security incidents.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.06.02.b. Report suspected incidents to the organizational incident response capability within {{ insert: param, param-030602b-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.06.02.c. Report incident information to {{ insert: param, param-030602c-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.06.02.d. Provide an incident response support resource that offers advice and assistance to system users on handling and reporting incidents.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.06.03. Test the effectiveness of the incident response capability {{ insert: param, param-030603-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.06.03  Incident Response Testing

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.06.04  Incident Response Training

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.06.04.a. Provide incident response training to system users consistent with assigned roles and responsibilities:

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.06.04.a.01. Within {{ insert: param, param-030604a01-1 }} of assuming an incident response role or responsibility or acquiring system access;

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03-06-04.a.02. When required by system changes; and

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03-06-04.a.03.	 {{ insert: param, param-030604a03-1 }} thereafter.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.06.04.b. Review and update incident response training content {{ insert: param, param-030604b-1 }} and following {{ insert: param, param-030604b-2 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.06.05  Incident Response Plan

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.06.05.a. Develop an incident response plan that:

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.06.05.a.01. Develop an incident response plan that provides the organization with a roadmap for implementing its incident response capability.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.06.05.a.02. Describes the structure and organization of the incident response capability,

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.06.05.a.03. Provides a high-level approach for how the incident response capability fits into the overall organization,

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.06.05.a.04. Defines reportable incidents,

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.06.05.a.05. Addresses the sharing of incident information, and

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.06.05.a.06.	 Designates responsibilities to organizational entities, personnel, or roles.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.06.05.b. Distribute copies of the incident response plan to designated incident response personnel (identified by name and/or by role) and organizational elements.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.06.05c. Update the incident response plan to address system and organizational changes or problems encountered during plan implementation, execution, or testing.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.06.05.d. Protect the incident response plan from unauthorized disclosure.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.07.04.c. Prevent the removal of system maintenance equipment containing CUI by verifying that there is no CUI on the equipment, sanitizing or destroying the equipment, or retaining the equipment within the facility.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.07.04.c. Prevent the removal of system maintenance equipment containing CUI by verifying that there is no CUI on the equipment, sanitizing or destroying the equipment, or retaining the equipment within the facility.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.07.04.c. Prevent the removal of system maintenance equipment containing CUI by verifying that there is no CUI on the equipment, sanitizing or destroying the equipment, or retaining the equipment within the facility.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.07.04  Maintenance Tools

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.07.04.a. Approve, control, and monitor the use of system maintenance tools.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.07.04.b. Check media with diagnostic and test programs for malicious code before it is used in the system.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.07.04.c. Prevent the removal of system maintenance equipment containing CUI by verifying that there is no CUI on the equipment, sanitizing or destroying the equipment, or retaining the equipment within the facility.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.07.05  Nonlocal Maintenance

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.07.05.a. Approve and monitor nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic activities.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.07.05.b. Implement multi-factor authentication and replay resistance in the establishment of nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic sessions.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.07.05.c. Terminate session and network connections when nonlocal maintenance is completed.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.07.06  Maintenance Personnel

parts.name: statement
parts.prose:
03.07.06.a. Establish a process for maintenance personnel authorization.
03.07.06.b. Maintain a list of authorized maintenance organizations or personnel.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.07.06.c. Verify that non-escorted personnel who perform maintenance on the system possess the required access authorizations.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.07.06.d. Designate organizational personnel with required access authorizations and technical competence to supervise the maintenance activities of personnel who do not possess the required access authorizations.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.08.01. Physically control and securely store system media that contain CUI.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.08.01  Media Storage

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.08.02. Restrict access to CUI on system media to authorized personnel or roles.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.08.02  Media Access

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.08.03. Sanitize system media that contain CUI prior to disposal, release out of organizational control, or release for reuse.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.08.03  Media Sanitization

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.08.04. Mark system media that contain CUI to indicate distribution limitations, handling caveats, and applicable CUI markings.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.08.04  Media Marking

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.08.05  Media Transport

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.08.05.a. Protect and control system media that contain CUI during transport outside of controlled areas.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.08.05.b. Maintain accountability of system media that contain CUI during transport outside of controlled areas.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.08.05.c. Document activities associated with the transport of system media that contain CUI.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.08.07  Media Use

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.08.07.a. Restrict or prohibit the use of {{ insert: param, param-030807a-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.08.07.b. Prohibit the use of removable system media without an identifiable owner.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.08.09  System Backup – Cryptographic Protection

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.08.09.a. Protect the confidentiality of backup information.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 3.8.9.b. Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent the unauthorized disclosure of CUI at backup storage locations.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.09.01  Personnel Screening

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.09.01.a. Screen individuals prior to authorizing access to the system.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.09.01.b. Rescreen individuals in accordance with {{ insert: param, param-030901b-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.09.02  Personnel Termination and Transfer

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.09.02.a. When individual employment is terminated:

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.09.02.a.01. Disable system access within {{ insert: param, param-030902a01-1 }};

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.09.02.a.02. Terminate or revoke authenticators and credentials associated with the individual; and

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.09.02.a.03. Retrieve security-related system property.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose:
03.09.02.b. When individuals are reassigned or transferred to other positions in the organization:
03.09.02.b.01. Review and confirm the ongoing operational need for current logical and physical access authorizations to the system and facility; and

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.09.02.b.02. Modify access authorization to correspond with any changes in operational need.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.10.01  Physical Access Authorizations

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.10.01.a. Develop, approve, and maintain a list of individuals with authorized access to the facility where the system resides.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.10.01.b. Issue authorization credentials for facility access.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.10.01.c. Review the facility access list {{ insert: param, param-031001c-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.10.01.d. Remove individuals from the facility access list when access is no longer required.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.10.02  Monitoring Physical Access

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.10.02.a. Monitor physical access to the facility where the system resides to detect and respond to physical security incidents.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.10.02.b. Review physical access logs {{ insert: param, param-031002b-1 }} and upon occurrence of {{ insert: param, param-031002b-2 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.10.06  Alternate Work Site

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.10.06.a. Determine alternate work sites allowed for use by employees.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.10.06.b. Employ the following security requirements at alternate work sites: {{ insert: param, param-031006b-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.10.07  Physical Access Control

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.10.07.a. Enforce physical access authorizations at entry and exit points to the facility where the system resides by:

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.10.07.a.01. Verifying individual physical access authorizations before granting access to the facility and

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.10.07.a.02. Controlling ingress and egress with physical access control systems, devices, or guards.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.10.07.b. Maintain physical access audit logs for entry or exit points.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.10.07.c. Escort visitors, and control visitor activity.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.10.07.d. Secure keys, combinations, and other physical access devices.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.10.7.e. Control physical access to output devices to prevent unauthorized individuals from obtaining access to CUI.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.10.08. Control physical access to system distribution and transmission lines within organizational facilities.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.10.08  Access Control for Transmission and Output Devices

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.11.01  Risk Assessment

parts.name: statement

parts.name: statement
parts.prose:
03.11.01.a. Assess the risk (including supply chain risk) of unauthorized disclosure resulting from the processing, storage, or transmission of CUI.

031101b-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.11.02  Vulnerability Monitoring and Scanning

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.11.02.a. Monitor and scan the system for vulnerabilities {{ insert: param, param-031102a-1 }} and when new vulnerabilities affecting the system are identified.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.11.02.b. Remediate system vulnerabilities within {{ insert: param, param-031102b-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.11.02.c. Update system vulnerabilities to be scanned {{ insert: param, param-031102c-1 }} and when new vulnerabilities are identified and reported.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.11.04  Risk Response

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.12.01. Assess the security requirements for the system and its environment of operation {{ insert: param, param-031201-1 }} to determine if the requirements have been satisfied.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.12.01  Control Assessments

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.12.02  Plan of Action and Milestones

parts.name: statement
parts.prose:
03.12.02.a. Develop a plan of action and milestones for the system:
03.12.02.a.01. To document the planned remediation actions to correct weaknesses or deficiencies noted during control assessments; and
03.12.02.a.02. To reduce or eliminate known vulnerabilities in the system.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose:
03.12.02.b. Update the existing plan of action and milestones based on the findings from:
03.12.02.b.01.	Security assessments,
03.12.02.b.02.	Audits or reviews, and
03.12.02.b.03.	Continuous monitoring activities.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.12.03. Develop and implement a system-level continuous monitoring strategy that includes ongoing monitoring and security assessments.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.12.03  Continuous Monitoring

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.12.05  Information Exchange

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.12.05.a. Approve and manage the exchange of CUI between the system and other systems using [Selection (one or more): interconnection security agreements; information exchange security agreements; memoranda of understanding or agreement; service-level agreements; user agreements; non-disclosure agreements; other types of agreements].

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.12.05.b. Document interface characteristics, security requirements, and responsibilities for each system as part of the exchange agreements.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.12.05.c. Review and update the exchange agreements {{ insert: param, param-031205c-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.13.01  Boundary Protection

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.13.01.a. Monitor and control communications at external managed interfaces to the system and key internal managed interfaces within the system.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.13.01.b. Implement subnetworks for publicly accessible system components that are physically or logically separated from internal networks.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.13.01.c. Connect to external systems only through managed interfaces that consist of boundary protection devices arranged in accordance with an organizational security architecture.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.13.04 Prevent unauthorized and unintended information transfer via shared system resources.

parts.name: statement

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.13.06. Deny network communications traffic by default, and allow network communications traffic by exception.

parts.name: statement

parts.prose: 03.13.8. Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent the unauthorized disclosure of CUI during transmission and while in storage.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.13.12  Collaborative Computing Devices and Applications

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.13.12.a. Prohibit the remote activation of collaborative computing devices and applications with the following exceptions: {{ insert: param, param-031312a-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 3.13.12.b. Provide an explicit indication of use to users physically present at the devices.

parts.name: statement

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.13.13.a. Define acceptable mobile code and mobile code technologies.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.13.13.b. Authorize, monitor, and control the use of mobile code.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.13.15. Protect the authenticity of communications sessions.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.13.15  Session Authenticity

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.14.01  Flaw Remediation

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.14.01.a. Identify, report, and correct system flaws.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.14.01.b. Install security-relevant software and firmware updates within {{ insert: param, param-031401b-1 }} of the release of the updates.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.14.02  Malicious Code Protection

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.14.02.a. Implement malicious code protection mechanisms at system entry and exit points to detect and eradicate malicious code.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.14.02.b. Update malicious code protection mechanisms as new releases are available in accordance with configuration management policies and procedures.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.14.02.c. Configure malicious code protection mechanisms to:

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.14.02.c.01. Perform scans of the system {{ insert: param, param-031402c01-1 }} and real-time scans of files from external sources at endpoints or network entry and exit points as the files are downloaded, opened, or executed; and

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.14.02.c.02. Block malicious code, quarantine malicious code, or take other mitigation actions in response to malicious code detection.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.14.03  Security Alerts, Advisories, and Directives

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.14.03.a. Receive system security alerts, advisories, and directives from external organizations on an ongoing basis.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.14.03.b. Generate and disseminate internal system security alerts, advisories, and directives, as necessary.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.14.06  System Monitoring

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.14.06.a. Monitor the system to detect:

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.14.06.a.01. Attacks and indicators of potential attacks;

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.14.06.a.02. Unauthorized connections.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.14.06.b. Identify unauthorized use of the system.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.14.06.c. Monitor inbound and outbound communications traffic to detect unusual or unauthorized activities or conditions.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.14.08. Manage and retain CUI within the system and CUI output from the system in accordance with applicable laws, Executive Orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, guidelines, and operational requirements.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.14.08: Information Management and Retention

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.15.01  Policy and Procedures

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.15.01.a. Develop, document, and disseminate to organizational personnel or roles the policies and procedures needed to satisfy the security requirements for the protection of CUI.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.15.01.b. Review and update policies and procedures {{ insert: param, param-031501b-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.15.01.b. Review and update policies and procedures periodically.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.15.02  System Security Plan

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.15.02.a. Develop a system security plan that:

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03-15-02.a.01. Defines the constituent system components;

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03-15-02.a.03. Describes specific threats to the system that are of concern to the organization.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.15.02.a.04. Describes the operational environment for the system and any dependencies on or connections to other systems or system components;

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.15.02.a.05. Provides an overview of the security requirements for the system;

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.15.02.a.06. Describes the safeguards in place or planned for meeting the security requirements;

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.15.02.a.07. Identifies individuals that fulfill system roles and responsibilities; and

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.15.02.b. Review and update the system security plan {{ insert: param, param-031502b-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.15.02.c. Protect the system security plan from unauthorized disclosure.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.15.03  Rules of Behavior

parts.name: statement
parts.prose:
03.15.03.a. Establish rules that describe the responsibilities and expected behavior for system usage and protecting CUI.
03-15-03.b. Provide rules to individuals who require access to the system.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.15.03.c. Receive a documented acknowledgement from individuals indicating that they have read, understand, and agree to abide by the rules of behavior before authorizing access to CUI and the system.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.15.03.d. Review and update the rules of behavior {{ insert: param, param-031503d-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.16.01: Security Engineering Principles

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.16.02  Unsupported System Components

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.16.02.a. Replace system components when support for the components is no longer available from the developer, vendor, or manufacturer.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.16.02.b. Provide options for risk mitigation or alternative sources for continued support for unsupported components that cannot be replaced.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.16.03  External System Services

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.16.03.a. Require the providers of external system services used for the processing, storage, or transmission of CUI, to comply with the following security requirements: {{ insert: param, param-031603a-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.16.03.b. Define and document user roles and responsibilities with regard to external system services, including shared responsibilities with external service providers.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.16.03.c. Implement processes, methods, and techniques to monitor security requirement compliance by external service providers on an ongoing basis.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.17.01  Supply Chain Risk Management Plan

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.17.01.a. Develop a plan for managing supply chain risks associated with the research, development, design, manufacturing, acquisition, delivery, integration, operations, maintenance, and disposal of the system, system components, or system services.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.17.01.b. Review and update the supply chain risk management plan {{ insert: param, param-031701b-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.17.01.c. Protect the supply chain risk management plan from unauthorized disclosure.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.17.02. Develop and implement acquisition strategies, contract tools, and procurement methods to identify, protect against, and mitigate supply chain risks.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.17.02  Acquisition Strategies, Tools, and Methods

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.17.03  Supply Chain Controls and Processes

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.17.03.a. Establish a process for identifying and addressing weaknesses or deficiencies in the supply chain elements and processes.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.17.03.b. Enforce the following security requirements to protect against supply chain risks to the system, system components, or system services and to limit the harm or consequences from supply chain-related events: {{ insert: param, param-031703b-1 }}.

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.16  Wireless Access

parts.name: statement
parts.prose: 03.01.16.d. Protect wireless access to the system using authentication and encryption.
